official_title: To direct the Secretary of the Treasury to incorporate certain features in the redesign of the United States currency so as to make such currency readily accessible to the visually impaired.

summary.text: Common Sense Currency Act of 1997 - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to incorporate in the redesign of each currency denomination these features: (1) a different size note; (2) large high-contrast numerals on a uniform background; (3) a clearly differentiated color scheme; and (4) specific engraved marks, both visible and invisible. Requires the redesign of U.S. currency to be cost-effective and have: (1) readily identifiable denominations; (2) no need for special devices other than everyday aids for identification of currency by the visually impaired; and (3) tactile features (including color and size features) to enable the blind and the visually impaired to use the currency.
